citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
One two-year-old alpaca (“Spot”) was observed during the inspection with a leaner appearance than expected for its age
and size. The inspector could visualize the silhouettes of some vertebral bones along its back, suggestive of decreased
body conditioning. When asked if the alpaca’s health status had been discussed with the attending veterinarian, the
licensee stated the facility hadn’t noticed the alpaca’s change in weight but would contact the veterinarian for a site visit
soon. The attending veterinarian was contacted and scheduled to come out before the inspection was concluded.
Failure to suitably observe all animals daily can result in deterioration of the animal's health, particularly when weight loss
may be ongoing, or its etiology is unknown. Daily observation of all animals shall be done to assess their health and well-
being. Timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being noted during daily
observations must be communicated to the attending veterinarian so that appropriate veterinary care can be provided.
Correct by October 25, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative and licensee.
